title: 2 injured after motorcyclist loses control
maintext:
ROXBURY — Driving on a sharp right curve, a motorcyclist carrying one passenger lost control of his vehicle Friday evening and slid across the road, according to an accident summary from Connecticut State Police. The incident took place on Good Hill Road near Bacon Road.
The passenger, ejected during the crash, was transported to Danbury Hospital with serious injuries, while the driver went to the same hospital with non-life threatening injuries, the report said.
Neither person involved was wearing a helmet, according to the accident summary.
Police are investigating the crash.
